ai.summary: Crowan BR 78 is a short, easy 1.1 km hike in the UK suitable for beginners and families. The route offers gentle terrain and minimal elevation, allowing a relaxed pace and easy enjoyment of the surroundings.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly level, with grassy or compacted gravel surfaces. Expect some damp patches after rain and occasional small bumps. Footwear with good grip is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Check local weather and daylight hours before starting. Stay on marked paths and respect private land. Be mindful of uneven ground and slippery patches after rain. Keep dogs under control and away from livestock or gates. Carry a small map or offline navigation, a charged phone, and a light layer of clothing for changing conditions.
ai.best_seasons: All year round, with spring and summer offering the most comfortable conditions.
